title: Professional Thanks and Follow-ups

sections.title: Gratitude in the Workplace
sections.content:
Saying 'thank you' is crucial in professional communication. It builds good relationships with colleagues, managers, and clients.

- **Immediate Thanks**: Sending a quick note after receiving help.
- **Follow-up Thanks**: Sending an email after a meeting or interview to show appreciation and interest.

sections.title: Common Thank You Phrases
sections.content:
- **Thank you for your help.**: Gracias por tu/su ayuda.
- **I appreciate your time.**: Agradezco tu/su tiempo.
- **Thank you for the information.**: Gracias por la información.
- **Many thanks for the update.**: Muchas gracias por la actualización.
- **I am writing to follow up on...**: Escribo para dar seguimiento a...

sections.title: Grammar: Object Pronouns
sections.content:
Object pronouns receive the action of the verb. We use them after verbs or prepositions.

- **Me / You / Him / Her / It / Us / Them**

- **Examples**:
  - *Can you help **me**?* (¿Puedes ayudarme?)
  - *I saw **him** in the meeting.* (Lo vi en la reunión.)
  - *Thank **them** for the report.* (Agrádéceles por el informe.)
  - *We like **it**.* (Nos gusta [ello].)

sections.title: Follow-up Vocabulary
sections.content:
- **Feedback**: Retroalimentación / Comentarios.
- **Appreciate**: Agradecer / Valorar.
- **Follow-up**: Seguimiento.
- **Opportunity**: Oportunidad.
- **Support**: Apoyo / Ayuda.

objectives: Write professional thank you emails and follow-ups
Identify and use object pronouns correctly in sentences
Use appropriate vocabulary for expressing appreciation in a work context
